channel.title: "Path cannot be specified"
channel.description:
Well, when i try to compile, i get that "Path cannot be specified" message..
What i did: I downloaded 22 JDK
I went into "Environment Variables" and changed CLASS and CLASSPATH to 22.
Please oh please help. I have Windows 7 if that helps.

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @Preist Preist
item.description:
@Preist wrote:

Still doesn’t work.

My friend said it COULD be the ports.

But i need a walk through for that. :x…

If it helps, i did NOT port forward, figuring i have no need to, hence i don’t wanna run a server for people. Just for myself.

I went into server.java, and found this for the port:

System.out.println("Server listening on port 0.0.0.0:" + serverlistenerPort);

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Preist, post:24, topic:364366”]But i want to connect to my localhost. O_O

My other servers/clients let me. :([/quote]

You want it to connect to your Localhost? Then you do not intend on letting others connect to your server.

In that case simply just change the Ip of the client. If it continues to let connect to yourself then change it to 0.0.0.0 even though their is no difference. Though it won’t hurt to try.

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Preist, post:22, topic:364366”]Nuu, you kept calling me a him. Just had to say i’m a girl.

BTW, yeah i’m trying to connect to localhost.[/quote]

My apologies, I didn’t know that you were a girl.

Then you shouldn’t be doing that. You are going to want to change the Ip (127.0.0.1) to the Ip you are wanting for example; serverhost.no-ip.org

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Preist, post:20, topic:364366”]But why can i run and log on other servers/clients of mine, and its just this 1 server and client i’m having trouble with?

BTW, i’m a girl. :x[/quote]

Being a girl has nothing to do it. Everyone is smart in their own ways, so don’t worry about it.

Anyway,

You are most likely logging into your Localhost (127.0.0.1)

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @Preist Preist
item.description:
@Preist wrote:

Yeahhhh… I found got a compiler to get my Client to work.

But now i tried to use it for my server, and it doesn’t work now.

help please?

EDIT: I got it to work!!!

I used

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java src\server\model\players\Quests*.java src\server\model\players\Content*.java
pause

for the server

and this for the client:

@echo off title Building Files "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe" -d ./Class/ Java/*.java Java/sign/*.java pause

NOWWWWW, i can run a gooooood server, but when i try to run my client for it, it doesn’t let me. It says “Error connecting to Server.” Even though i edited all the IP’s in gui and client.java’s…

My friend says i need to portforward. But i don’t see why, hence i can run different servers/clients…

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

alright. Right click run.bat or compile.bat. whatever you use to compile and delete everything out of there and put

@echo off
title Compiler
“C:/Program Files (x86)/Java\jdk1.6.0_22/bin/javac.exe” *.java
@echo You have compiled the Server.
pause

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @Preist Preist
item.description:
@Preist wrote:

I don’t understand the

Right click run.bat, leave it open.

Where you see “C:\program files\java\jdk\xxxxxxxxx” delete that (from " -> ")

at all.

And your My computer > stuff is confusing, cause i’m Windows 7, and its not really set up like that. :x

I made it to the javac.bat. But i got lost on where to put the:
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe

Its in General where i put that, right?

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

o.0 Okay, do this:

Right click run.bat, leave it open.

Where you see “C:\program files\java\jdk\xxxxxxxxx” delete that (from " -> ")

Then, do this:

My computer -> HDD C: -> Program Files -> Java -> Jdk1.x.x.x -> bin -> right click properties on Javac.exe
Then, find the path (should be: “C:\Program Files\Java\jdkx.x.x_xx\bin”)
Then, make that line this:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe”
Then, copy that line into where your previous:
“C:\programfiles etc etc” was in the compiler/runserver.bat
Then, close and try again

Hope it wasn’t too confusing.

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @Preist Preist
item.description:
@Preist wrote:

So many questions.

  1. It is in the Programs file/folder? idk. :x… I search JDK on my Start tab and it says its in Programs, but idk…

  2. Yes i’m using a PI source/client

  3. No this is not packaged (if you mean source and client in 1 folder)

Ground zero 317; it doesn’t work

Soulcist, the codes you gave me didn’t work either. :x…

Deathschaos9, IDK if you mean this, but i have this:

VARIABLE: CLASS
VARIABLE VALUE: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin;

VARIABLE: CLASSPATH
VARIABLE VALUE: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Well… I suppose you could start off with this mate; You are most likely using Project-Insanity if its packaged?

This is for 64 bit and if it still doesn’t work. You can try doing what Deathschaos9 said to do and clarify what it needs to compile and stuff.

@echo off :build cls "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause goto :build

Read full topic

item.title: "Path cannot be specified"
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:7, topic:364366”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=460583.msg3369642#msg3369642 date=1287109479]

Indeed.
Interesting that this doesn’t work assuming he has Windows 7. Therefore his Java should be in the x86 bin.

Mate… Were did you download your JDK to?

Its not saying Javac isn’t found, it cannot find any java source files. I imagine his server is packaged.
[/quote]

Then that means he would have to have something like Project-Insanity’s compiler? 0.0
I’m learning too from this xD.[/quote]
Yes, he would need to define what paths to compile.

Read full topic
